definition[0]: not moving, but ready to move or do something at any moment
example[0]: She waited by the door like a small animal poised for flight.
example[1]: His finger was poised on the cameraâ€™s shutter release.
example[2]: He stood on the edge of the roof, poised to jump.
definition[1]: completely ready to do something or for something to happen, when it is likely to happen soon
example[3]: The economy is poised on the edge of collapse.
note[3]: poised on the brink/edge of something
example[4]: Spain was poised to become the dominant power in Europe.
definition[2]: behaving in a calm confident way, and able to control your feelings and reactions
example[5]: Abigail walked to the microphone, poised and confident.
